newsitem.title: USA: Hemispherx to start chronic fatigue trial.
newsitem.headline: Hemispherx to start chronic fatigue trial.

text.p: Hemispherx Biopharma Inc said Wednesday that the U.S. Food and Drug Administration has authorized the company to charge, on a cost recovery basis, for its proprietary drug, Ampligen, which is to be used in an open-label clinical trial for Chronic Fatigue Syndrome/Chronic Fatigue Immune Dysfunction Syndrome (CFS/CFIDS).
An open-label trial is one in which there is no placebo control group.
The company said the open-label trial will begin immediately and that it will initially treat 20 patients under this program.
The drug pricing was established under FDA guidelines and enables Hemispherx to recover costs of manufacture, research, development and handling of the expanded access program.
Hemispherx also said that it had agreed with the FDA to conduct a placebo-controlled clinical trial of Ampligen in patients suffering from CFS/CFIDS.
CFS/CFIDS is a multisystem syndrome characterized by debilitating fatigue, frequently associated with severe muscle ache, headache, sore throat, low grade fever and tender lymph nodes.
